question: 貫通
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: When you <kanji>pierce</kanji> some fabric with a needle it needs to <kanji>pass through</kanji> to the other side to actually <vocabulary>pierce</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>penetrate</vocabulary> it. Make sure it goes all the way through if you want to sew properly.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
